text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Atul a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Dublin today
I'm going to show you how to use AWS
identity and access management service
to allow access to AWS accounts from
users or roles in a separate AWS account
let's get started after logging into the
AWS Management console now we into the
IM console on the left hand side choose
roles and then choose create role choose
another A's account as a type of rested
entity enter the account ID of the
source account that will assume this
role and then choose next select the
policies that Grant the necessary
permissions for this role in the Target
account and then choose
next here enter a name for the role note
that setting TX is optional but adding
taxs to the role helps you to identify
the purpose of the roles
later add any tags that you want and
then choose create
role when the role is created choose the
role name to edit
it navigate to the trust relationships
Tab and then choose edit trust
policy here you can see that the
external AWS account is added as rested
entity note that the trust policy can
also be scoped to a particular role or
user as well and not just to the account
only review and then update the trust
policy by choosing update
policy next step is to Grant permissions
in the source account for the users who
assume the role to make the relevant API
call I'll Now navigate to the imem
console and will edit an existing user
to include a policy that allows it to
assume the role in the Target account
after logging into the AWS Management
console of the source account navigate
to the IM am
console on the left hand side choose
policies and then choose create
policy next for specifying permissions
I'll choose the visual Editor to
generate the policy choose a service and
select STDs from the drop-down list from
the access level section expand the
right actions and then choose assume Ro
action after that go through the
resources section choose specific and
then select add errands option to
restrict access from the pop-up window
select text and paste the Amazon
resource name or Arn of the role to be
assumed in the text box that was created
in the destination account
earlier then choose add errands and
select
next from theem console select
users select the user or role that you
want to assume the role in the
destination account from the IM am users
list I'll select my IM am user
Alice next select the permissions Tab
and choose add
permissions in this window choose attach
policies
directly from the permission policies
listed search for the policy that we
created earlier and then select
it now choose next and then add
permissions
finally sign into the source account as
the IM am user
Alice to assume the role in the
destination account select the name from
the doown list at the top right of the
navigation
menu select switch
roll next the IM IM user must provide
the account ID of the destination
account and also the imem role name that
you want to assume you can find this
information at the end of the roles a
Arn the display name is optional and can
be left alone as it is choose switch
roll your IM user is now logged into the
destination account by means of the
assumed role you can verify this by
checking the account name again at the
top right of the console
screen now you know how to use I am to
allow access to AWS accounts from users
or roles in a separate AWS
account thanks for for watching and
happy cloud computing from all of us
here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
